articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Mines in Komdok Area
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Mines in Komdok Area
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to mines in Komdok area in South Hamgyong Province.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Taehung Youth Hero Mine.
					
					After being briefed on the scientific and technological achievements made by the mine, Kim Jong Il went round several production processes for hours to learn in detail about the technological updating and situation of production there.
					
					 It is a great feat of weighty significance in the industrial development of the country that officials, technicians and workers of the mine have successfully realized the Juche-orientation of the production of magnesia clinker totally based on domestic raw materials by their own efforts, he said, highly praising their feats and giving his heartfelt thanks to them.
					
					 Saying that the technological progress made by the officials, technicians and workers of the mine, pioneers in making the national economy Juche-oriented, is admirable heroic feat, he bestowed warm love for them by designating the mine as Taehung Youth Hero Mine.
					
					 He underlined the need for all fields including the metal industry to zealously follow the example of the mine so as to successfully carry out the work for putting the national economy on a Juche-oriented basis.
					
					 And he went round a mine village built into a socialist-style fairy land.
					
					 He set forth the highly important tasks to be fulfilled by the mine, stressing that the mine should be renewed in a prospective way to turn into a world leading mineral producer.
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Komdok Mining Complex, a gigantic nonferrous mineral production base.
					
					 Going round the Dressing Plant No. 2, the June 5 Pumping Station and other places, he acquainted himself in detail with the performance of technological updating and production.
					
					 Expressing his great satisfaction over the fact that the miners of Komdok have radically increased the mineral production by laying a material and technological foundation of the mine and done a lot of work including the establishment of excellent production culture, he highly appreciated their achievements. 
					
					 Then he was informed of how the complex runs its supply service bases and went round a miners' rest room at the Kumgol Mine before highly appreciating the efforts made by officials of the complex.
					
					 He stressed that deep care should be always shown for the miners' life, saying that health of the workers, a precious asset of the Party and the revolution, is more valuable than underground treasure. And he advanced highly important tasks facing the mine.
					
					 He also gave field guidance to the Ryongyang Mine.
					
					 After being briefed on the mine before its panoramic map, he went into the June 5 Pit to acquaint himself with the work of putting the cutting on large-sized and modern basis.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the workers of Paekgumsan have doubled the mineral production by securing rich ore reserves and introducing the advanced cutting method and highly estimated their labour feats.
					
					 Watching the members of the Hero Excavator No.7 Workteam at work, he gave pep-talks to them fully displaying the stamina of the workteam in the 150-day campaign.
					
					 He met again with Song Sun Ae who encouraged the members of the workteam to performing feats, working as its agitator for many years and highly praised her efforts.
					
					 Then he set forth the tasks to be carried out by the mine.
					
					 It is very proud to see the mines in the Komdok area where miners are making continued leap and advance, full of vigor, at the worksites turned into a people's paradise, he said, expressing great satisfaction at the fact that the mines in the area have undergone great changes in recent years.
					
					 Accompanying him were Secretary Kim Ki Nam and department directors Pak Nam Gi and Jang Song Thaek of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Talks between Parliamentary Delegations of DPRK and Indonesia Held
articles.content:
Talks between Parliamentary Delegations of DPRK and Indonesia Held
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegation of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the delegation of the Parliament of Indonesia were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the members of the delegation of the SPA of the DPRK headed by Chairman Choe Thae Bok and from the opposite side were the members of the delegation of the Parliament of Indonesia headed by Speaker Agung Laksono and Indonesian Ambassador to the DPRK Daulat Hotma Audison Passaribu.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the relations between the parliaments of the two countries and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Vice-President of SPA Presidium Meets UK Delegation
articles.content:
Vice-President of SPA Presidium Meets UK Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with the delegation of the Associated Press Television News of the United Kingdom led by its Executive Director Nigel Baker at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Gift from UK Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Gift from UK Figure
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the head of the delegation of the Associated Press Television News of the United Kingdom on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Nigel Baker, executive director of the above-said news, who is leading the delegation on Wednesday.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Here
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian parliamentary delegation headed by Speaker Agung Laksono arrived here today.
					 A delegation of the Brazilian Workers' Party led by Secretary for International Relations of its National Executive Committee Valter Pomar also arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: FIFA Futsal Refereeing Course Held in DPRK
articles.content:
FIFA Futsal Refereeing Course Held in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- A FIFA Futsal Refereeing Course was held of late at the Handball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street, Pyongyang.
					 The course was attended by FIFA international and national referees.
					
					 The explanation of the game rules, foul movements, newly changed game rules and other issues were dealt with in the course.
					
					 The course was given by Mousavi Seyed Sadrodin, a futsal refereeing lecturer of FIFA.

articles.title: Historic Spring Meeting at Mingyuegou
articles.content:
Historic Spring Meeting at Mingyuegou
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung regarded it as the linchpin to win over the masses on which depended the victory or failure of the revolution in the early days of his revolutionary activities and established the tradition of closest unity through a practical struggle. This immortal exploit is recounted by the spring meeting at Mingyuegou held in the days of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					The situation was grim, indeed, in the early 1930s.
					
					The white terrorism of the Japanese imperialists triggered off by the May 30 Uprising, started by the sectarian-flunkeys without any detailed plan or organizational measures, and the August 1 Uprising swept Manchuria with greater intensity from the beginning of 1931. 
					
					The Japanese imperialists went on a rampage in a repressive racket everywhere to uproot the revolutionary organizations built by the Korean revolutionaries and patriots with much effort for years.
					
					Not only hardcore revolutionaries but also people who had followed the uprisings were all arrested or executed so that nearly all the revolutionary organizations in Jiandao were destroyed.
					
					Grave were the consequences of the May 30 Uprising.
					
					To cope with the situation the President moved the theater of activity to east Manchuria, where he launched into a gallant work to rally the people high in revolutionary spirit while giving guidance to various revolutionary organizations.
					
					After grasping the situation down to details while restoring and putting in order the wrecked revolutionary organizations, the President convened a meeting of Party and Young Communist League cadres at Mingyuegou in mid-May, Juche 20 (1931).
					
					At the meeting he made the historic speech "Let Us Repudiate the 'Left' Adventurist Line and Follow the Revolutionary Organizational Line."
					
					He in the speech gave a deep-going analysis to and reviewed the essence of the May 30 Uprising and put forth a revolutionary organizational line on closing the whole nation into one political force by firmly rallying the basic masses of the revolution and closely uniting the anti-Japanese forces of all strata around them.
					
					The line was fully supported by the participants in the meeting as it was the most correct line for saving the Korean revolution from the crisis and closely uniting broad masses on the side of the revolution.
					
					After the meeting the revolutionary organizations in Antu, not to speak of Mingyuegou, began to operate in a short time and local organizations in many areas became active one by one.
					
					It provided favorable conditions for bringing an upswing in the revolution in east Manchuria and, furthermore, in the overall areas of the homeland and developing the anti-Japanese struggle for national liberation into an organized armed struggle.
					
					The spring meeting at Mingyuegou was, indeed, a historic meeting that brought about a fresh turn in wining over the masses on which depended the victory or failure of the revolution.

articles.title: Wit of Woman Commander Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wit of Woman Commander Kim Jong Suk
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- It is a story in May Juche 22 (1933) when anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk went to a village for restoring the destroyed organizations in enemy-controlled areas.
					In order to bind the secret agents hand and foot who were active in villages under the enemy's control at that time, she indicated a clever method to the village chief.
					
					In one morning the village chief called a secret agent who had been regarded as the most villainous one among secret agents and made one complaint after another about the political situation with him.
					
					Then the agent responded to the chief, saying that the society must be overthrown by the guerrillas or others at an early date.
					
					The chief asked him how many people were there like him.
					
					The agent named several other secret agents while trying to worm the whereabouts of guerrillas and underground workers out of him.
					
					The chief drubbed the agent, who revealed his true color as cat's paw, on the face with fist, saying that he captured a true communist and telling the agent to go to the police station together at once.
					
					After the chief threatened the agent, who begged earnestly, with punishment for a while, he released him and said that he should go to a road expansion project and remould his wrong idea.
					
					Next day, at the dictate of the village chief, some ten secret agents went to the project site to work for a month, labeled as "situation complainer".
					
					Irritated as they were by this, the police officers were at the loss what to do.
					
					The village chief admired the wit of Kim Jong Suk who bound the secret agents hand and foot.

articles.title: KCNA Rebuffs Aso's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
KCNA Rebuffs Aso's Reckless Remarks
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Aso is talking about the resumption of talks while taking issue with the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					 During his visit to Europe including the Czech Republic, he expressed "thanks" to the EU for issuing a "statement" critical of the DPRK and implored European countries to express "support" and "solidarity" in the efforts for the early resumption of the six-party talks.
					
					 At the plenary session of the House of Councillors on April 28 he blustered that he would "make north Korea accept the presidential statement with a heavy heart" and "strongly urge it to return to the six-party talks and fully implement the joint statement". And at the meeting of the Budgetary Committee of the House of Representatives on May 7 he jabbered that "the six-party talks are the most realistic means for settling the issue".
					
					 His remarks are, indeed, impudent and shameless.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the Japanese chief executive has neither face nor justification to talk about the six-party talks.
					
					 Aso seriously defiled the sovereignty of the DPRK, a basis on which any talks should be held, over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 Before the launch he declared "interception" as a state policy, issued an order to the "Self-Defense Forces" to shoot down the satellite and after the launch he termed it a "provocative act".
					
					 Everything he has done is a base behavior quite contrary to the spirit of respect for sovereignty and sovereignty equality, the life and soul of the six-party talks, in every respect. 
					
					 One cannot but ask Aso so talkative about the resumption of the talks if he has a normal thinking faculty. 
					
					 He is becoming so vociferous about the talks after violating and defiling the sovereignty of the DPRK, not prompted by his wish to see the talks prove successful and the Korean Peninsula denuclearized.
					
					 Japan has made desperate efforts to throw hurdles in the process of the talks throughout their history.
					
					 It raised the "abduction issue" irrelevant to the agenda of the talks, throwing a hurdle in their way and totally refusing to fulfil its obligation under the agreement of the talks.
					
					 Lurking behind Japan's talk about the resumption of the talks is a foolish aim to include the "nuclear, missile and abduction issues" in the agenda of the six-party talks under the pretext of the DPRK's satellite launch in a bid to secure a justification to turn it into a military power, realize its old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" it failed to do in the past and evade the responsibility for liquidating its past. 
					
					 The present Japanese chief executive is a descendant of the family of a wicked militarist maniac who was steeped in the ambition for aggression against the DPRK to the marrow of his bones, regarding militarism as a mode of existence generation after generation. His great grandfather forcibly walked away Koreans to Japan and forced them to do slave labor at coal mines. His maternal grandfather, a top-class anti-communist conservative, insisted that Korea should not be given the status of victor after World War II.
					
					 Born into such family, Aso asserted that Koreans "changed their names into Japanese ones" according to "their hope" though the Japanese imperialists forced them to do so and termed the Pacific war a "greater East Asia war".
					
					  It is now clear why Aso is trumpeting about the resumption of the talks though he is a boss of militarists in whose vein runs their blood.
					
					 What he seeks is nothing but a sinister aim to bring the issues irrelevant to the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula to the negotiating table in an effort to becloud the nature of the talks and use them as a platform for realizing militarization and evading the responsibility for redressing Japan's past. 
					
					 Availing ourselves of this opportunity, we would like to tell something to Aso.
					
					 The DPRK has already made it clear that there is no more need to have the six-party talks now that they have been reduced to a platform for encroaching upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and disarming it.
					
					  For the Japanese chief executive to keep peddling the issue of resuming the talks and "fulfillment of commitment" under this situation amounts to encroaching upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and interfering in its internal affairs.
					
					 If he persistently clings to the hostile policy toward the DPRK, unaware of what is happening in the world, he will suffer only bitter disgrace and ruin.

articles.title: Abe's Militarist Outbursts Flayed
articles.content:
Abe's Militarist Outbursts Flayed
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Abe, when referring to the prime minister's visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" during his recent TV appearance, let loose a spate of reckless remarks that it is natural for the leader of the country to pay respects to those who fell in actions for the country and those who died for the sake of the country. He added he deemed it right to do so.  
					 He uttered that he refrained from paying a visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" during the tenure of office as prime minister because he made a "crucial decision to pave the road for the future" of Japan.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Those who fell in actions for the "country" as claimed by Abe are those who met deaths while committing all sorts of shuddering atrocities in the wars of aggression against Korea and other Asian countries. 
					
					 What Abe uttered is little short of blustering that a prime minister should make every possible effort to repeat the past history of aggression as the ruler and the commander of the armed forces.
					
					 His career can be called a model of the course of life covered by a militarist. 
					
					 It was Abe that categorically denied the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past and zealously supported the moves to delete or play down their crimes of aggression in the history textbooks. It was again Abe who incited militarism, highly praising the practices of hoisting "Hinomaru" and singing "Kimigayo" at schools.
					
					 It was none other than Abe who issued an instruction to abolish the measure to exempt the facilities related to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan from taxes, the first of its kind in Japan's history, and kick up a wholesale campaign of suppression of Chongryon.
					
					 As long as ultra-right elements like Abe are allowed to strut about, whipping up militarism, Japan cannot become a pacifist state and they will drive the war chariot of militarism at a rapid tempo towards Asia. 
					
					 No future is in store for those who are keen to turn back the wheel of history, agitating a war. 
					
					 As long as such dregs of history as Abe are allowed to strut about, the Japanese people will be seized with increased uneasiness and the future of the country will get gloomier.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Increasing Pressure upon DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Increasing Pressure upon DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- It is an inviolable legitimate right for every country and nation to exercise their sovereignty. No force on earth can hold in check the struggle of every country and nation desirous of independence to exercise their sovereign rights.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The imperialists and their followers are persistently barring all other countries and nations from exercising their legitimate rights and working hard to make sure that only their hegemonic and unilateral high-handed and arbitrary practices are workable in the international arena.
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that the United States recently forced the UN Security Council to adopt what it called the "presidential statement" over the DPRK's launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 for peaceful purposes in a bid to increase the pressure upon it. 
					
					 Many countries and nations of the world are further intensifying than ever before their activities to exercise their sovereign rights, opposed to the imperialists' policies for domination and hegemony. 
					
					 For every country and nation to exercise their legitimate sovereign rights is prerequisite to accomplishing the cause of global independence.
					
					 The great Songun politics now in force in the DPRK serves as a powerful treasured sword for dealing telling blows at the imperialists and their followers and an invincible banner encouraging progressive mankind. 
					
					 If every country and nation is to exercise their sovereign rights, they should bolster up their military power for self -defence. The military muscle for self-defence provides a sure guarantee for the exercise of sovereign right.
					
					 If a country lacks the principle of independence, firm faith and will and grit in the present complicated world where the imperialist forces' counter-revolutionary offensive is getting more undisguised than ever before, it can neither maintain its revolutionary stand and principle nor fully exercise its sovereign right. 
					
					 The Korean people will continue fully exercising their sovereign rights, holding high the banner of Songun in the future, too, concludes the article.

articles.title: S. Korean Bellicose Forces' Military Maneuvers Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Bellicose Forces' Military Maneuvers Censured
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The puppet defense minister of south Korea recently appeared at the "command of the third field army" and called on the troops "to be combat ready to win even in case a battle breaks out right now," while vociferating about someone's "provocation." The puppet military reinforced warships and armed forces along and near the "northern limit line in the West Sea" and formed a "task force to be ready to go into action in half an hour" and deployed it on Yonphyong Islet. It also conducted a secret exercise for special warfare by use of military planes under the pretext of coping with "aerial intrusion into south Korea."
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 This move is a dangerous one to ignite a war of aggression against the north at any cost, taking advantage of the tense situation, as it is an open military provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 "Provocation" touted by the war-like forces of the puppet military which reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!" is nothing but a trick to cover up their bellicose scenario and justify their moves to launch a war of aggression against the north.
					
					 These reckless war moves stepped up by the puppet military are rendering the inter-Korean relations tenser than ever before and increasing the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula hour by hour. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group's persistent moves to provoke a new war despite the DPRK's repeated warnings are as foolish an act as precipitating its own self-destruction.
					
					 The justice-loving army of Songun in the DPRK will never allow the enemies of peace to trifle the destiny of the nation in conspiracy with outsiders, challenging the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 The Lee group had better cool its head heated with war fever and behave with discretion.

articles.title: Democratization of S. Korean Society Called for
articles.content:
Democratization of S. Korean Society Called for
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is frantically resorting to the fascist suppression of the progressive organizations for the reunification movement and patriotic people by enforcing dictatorship under the signboard of "pragmatism." This reality clearly indicates that it is impossible to achieve national reconciliation and unity and the reunification of the country unless the south Korean society is democratized.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The people in south Korea can neither have free discussion and activities for national reunification nor can the fellow countrymen in the north and the south have contact, exchange and pool their minds and will as long as a fascist rule is enforced and dictatorship is rampant in south Korea.
					
					 It is the law governing the development of history that the new is sure to win and the old bound to go ruin. The history of the struggle of the south Korean people for democracy against dictatorship goes to prove that the era of fascist dictatorship can never last long.
					
					 The doom of the Lee Myung Bak regime is a matter of time as it is prolonging its remaining days by dint of dictatorship and suppression, forsaken by the people.
					
					 There is nothing to be expected from the fascist regime veiled with the word of "pragmatism" and there is no need to follow its attitude any longer. 
					
					 The south Korean people should hold higher the banner of the anti-"government" struggle and wage an indomitable struggle to put an end to the Lee group's fascist dictatorial rule.
					
					 This is the only way of achieving national independence and the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Struggle against Dictatorial Regime Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against Dictatorial Regime Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea issued a statement on May 16, contending that the Lee Myung Bak dictatorial regime should be forced to step down so as to get the payment for the blood shed by those involved in the May 18 Kwangju uprising. 
					 The statement said that the present situation prevailing in south Korea due to the Lee Myung Bak murderous and dictatorial regime is reminiscent of the situation of Kwangju 29 years ago.
					
					 The present regime is unhesitatingly and sinisterly attempting to quell the May 18 resistance spirit by pulling down the former South Jolla Provincial Office associated with the soul of the Kwangju uprisers, it charged.
					
					 Any dictator engaged in suppression, exploitation and murder of the people is bound to face their strong resistance, the statement said, calling upon all the people to turn out in the struggle for forcing the Lee Myung Bak dictatorial regime to step down by inheriting the spirit of the Kwangju uprisers.
					
					 The statement stressed that death-defying struggle should be waged to force the murderous and dictatorial regime to step down and get the payment for the blood shed by the martyrs.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-reunification Racket Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-reunification Racket Flayed
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Youth League in Japan and its affiliated organizations released a joint statement on May 10, denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors' frantic crackdown on reunification movement organizations in south Korea.
					 Referring to the fact that the "Intelligence Service" and the police of south Korea are suppressing the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and youth organizations across south Korea, the statement branded such violence as quite unreasonable act.
					
					 The statement charged that the present south Korean authorities have totally denied the June 15 joint declaration and bedeviled the south-north relations which were favorably developing and deteriorated the people's livelihood by driving the economy to collapse while engaging themselves in the fascist dictatorial rule to harshly repress the popular masses.
					
					 Strongly condemning the Lee Myung Bak regime's vicious suppression, it demanded that the south Korean authorities immediately release the unjustly-arrested pro-reunification personages and abrogate the "National Security Law," an anti-reunification evil law, at an earlier date.

articles.title: Conversan en Pyongyang parlamentarios de Corea e Indonesia
articles.content:
Conversan en Pyongyang parlamentarios de Corea e Indonesia
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 20 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae  las conversaciones entre las delegaciones de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de la Asamblea Nacional de la Republica de Indonesia.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion de la APS encabezada por el presidente, Choe Thae Bok, y por la indonesia, los integrantes de la delegacion de la Asamblea Nacional encabezada por el presidente, Agung Laksono, y el embajador indonesio en Corea, Daulat Hotma Audison Passaribu.
					
					  Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones acerca del mayor desarrollo de las relaciones entre los parlamentos de los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: ATCC comenta intento de Aso de reanudar conversaciones a 6 bandas
articles.content:
ATCC comenta intento de Aso de reanudar conversaciones a 6 bandas
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- El premier japones Aso habla tanto de la reanulacion de las conversaciones a 6 bandas acusando el lanzamiento del satelite pacifico por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  Visitando Checo y otros paises europeos, Aso expreso el "agradecimiento" por la publicacion de la declaracion de la Union Europea que censuro a la RPDC y les solicito manifestar el "apoyo" y la "solidaridad" a la reanulacion previa de la cita 6 bandas.
					
					   El 28 de abril, en una sesion del senado dijo que "haria que el Norte de Corea acepte seriamente la declaracion presidencial del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU" y que "exigiria fuertemente que el Norte de Corea vuelva a las conversaciones a 6 bandas y ejecute por completo la declaracion conjunta". El 7 de mayo, en la Comision del Presupuesto de la camara de representantes hablo de que "el proyecto mas realista en la solucion del problema es las conversaciones a 6 bandas".
					
					  De veras, tal conducta es insolente y descarada.
					
					  A decir evidentemente, Aso no tiene ninguna obligacion de hablar de susodicha cita.
					
					    En cuanto al lanzamiento del satelite pacifico de la RPDC, Aso insulto gravemente la soberania de la RPDC, base de las conversaciones en cuestion.
					
					  Antes de lanzarlo, el promulgo la "interceptacion" contra dicho satelite como politica estatal del Japon y dio a las "Fuerzas de Autodenfesiva" la "orden de destruirlo" y despues de lanzarlo, lo califico de "accion provocativa".
					
					  Todos los actos de Aso son viles que contravienen al espiritu del respeto a la soberania y su igualdad, que son estrictamente la vida de las conversaciones a 6 bandas.
					
					   No podemos menos de preguntar si tal tipejo, que habla tanto de la reanulacion de las conversaciones, es o no el ser humano con la facultad de pensar normal.
					
					   Aso habla mucho de la reanudacion de dicha cita, pero, no quiere la realizacion de la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana mediante las conversaciones.
					
					  En el pasado, Japon vino maniobrando perversamente para estorbar todas las conversaciones a seis bandas. Presentando alli el "problema de secuestro" que no tiene nada que ver con el punto de la agenda de la cita, impidio la marcha de esta y nego totalmente la ejecucion de su deber relativo al acuerdo de 6 partes.
					
					  La razon por la cual el pais isleno insiste en la reanudacion de conversaciones reside en incluir el "problema de las armas nucleares, misiles y el secuestro" en la agenda de las conversaciones a 6 bandas en relacion con el lanzamiento de nuestro satelite, adquirir el pretexto de su conversion en la potencia militar, realizar el antiguo sueno de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" no logrado y eludir  la liquidacion del pasado criminal.
					
					  Aso es el descendiente de la familia del monstruoso militarista, acostumbrado del militarismo y ambicionado de la agresion a Corea de generacion en generacion.
					
					  Su bisabuelo arresto forzosamente a los  coreanos para imponerles duros trabajos de esclavitud en las minas de de carbon de Japon, mientras tanto, su abuelo materno, conservador anticomunista de categoria especial hablo de que no debe dar a Corea la posicion del pais victorioso despues del cese de la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
					
					   Por esta razon, Aso describio el "cambio de apellido de coreanos con el japones" impuesto por  los imperialistas japoneses como si "lo desearan los coreanos" y califico la Guerra Pacifica de la "guerra para la gran Asia Oriental".
					
					  Es muy evidente el intento de Aso de reanudar las conversaciones a 6 partes.
					
					  El trata de hacer intransparente el caracter de las conversaciones al presentar los problemas que no tienen que ver nada con la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana y de aprovecharlas en realizar la militarizacion y eludir la liquidacion del pasado criminal.
					
					  En esta ocasion, le aclaramos a Aso que habiamos declarado que para la RPDC no son necesarias por mas tiempo las conversaciones a 6 bandas, ya que estas se convirtieron en un lugar para violar la soberania de la RPDC y desarmar a esta.
					
					  Sin embargo, si el gobernador japones sigue hablando de la reanudacion de las conversaciones y la supuesta "ejecucion de la obligacion", tal conducta sera violacion a la soberania de Corea e injerencia en sus asuntos internos.
					
					 Si Aso recurre a la politica hostil a la RPDC sin darse cuenta de la situacion del mundo,  no evitara jamas la amarga verguenza y ruina.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena disparate militarista de Abe
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena disparate militarista de Abe
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- Hace poco, a traves de un programa radial de Japon, Abe defendio la visita del premier japones al "Santuario Yasukuni" diciendo asi: "es natural y justo que el mandatario expresara el homenaje a los combatientes y martires caidos mientras luchaban por el pais".
					  El ex premier prosiguio que el no ha visitado ese lugar durante su mandato porque habia tomado la "gran determinacion de sentar la base para el futuro" de Japon.
					
					  Al respecto, el diario Rodong Sinmun publico este miercoles un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					  Los "martires" mencionados por Abe son los tipejos que murieron mientras cometian horribles atrocidades en las guerras de agresion a Corea y otros paises asiaticos.
					
					  En este sentido, el disparate de Abe significa que el premier debe hacer todo lo posible como gobernante y comandante del ejercito para repetir la historia de agresiones del pasado.
					
					  La biografia de Abe es el ejemplo de la vida militarista.
					
					  Entre sus pecados militaristas se cuentan la negacion del caso de "consoladoras sexuales" para el viejo ejercito japones, el estimulo a la omision y disminucion de los crimenes del pasado en el manual de historia y la defensa activa del izamiento de "Hinomaru" y de la entonacion de "Kimigayo" en las escuelas.
					
					  En particular, el habia levantado la ola de brutal represion a la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon) siendo el primero en ordenar la invalidacion de la medida de eximicion de impuestos sobre los establecimientos de esta entidad.
					
					  Mientras que en Japon se pasean libremente los ultraderechistas como Abe inculcando el militarismo, este pais isleno no sera jamas un Estado pacifista y el desenfrenado carruaje de guerra militarista se acometera a toda fuerza contra el continente asiatico.
					
					  No tienen futuro los que agitan la guerra e intentan dar marcha atras a la historia.
					
					  Si los residuos de la historia como Abe siguen actuando a sus caprichos en Japon, crecera la inquietud de los habitantes japoneses y sera mas tenebroso el futuro del pais isleno.

articles.title: Corea: impartido cursillo para arbitros de futsal de la FIFA
articles.content:
Corea: impartido cursillo para arbitros de futsal de la FIFA
  Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- El lector competente de la FIFA, Mousavi Seyed Sadrodin, impartio recientemente en el Centro de Balonmano del capitalino Reparto Chongchun el cursillo para los arbitros de futsal de la FIFA.
					  A la ocasion asistieron los arbitros internacionales y nacionales de la FIFA.
					
					  Entre los problemas abordados figuran la explicacion sobre las reglas de juego, los movimientos de falta y el reglamento enmendado de ese deporte.
